intro: Hyptis madrensis, commonly known as Madreños mint, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, opposite leaves that are often grayish-green in color. It produces clusters of small, white or pale blue flowers that bloom in the summer months. Hyptis madrensis is often used in traditional medicine for its purported antiseptic and anti-inflammatory properties.
